message.entry: Invalid data type. Complex inputs must be double or single.
Invalid data type. First input must be double or single.
Invalid data type. First input must be real.
"Endpoints" value must be real.
Invalid data type. First input must be numeric or logical.
Incorrect number of input arguments. "Endpoints" must be followed by a corresponding value.
"Endpoints" value must be "shrink", "discard", "fill", or a numeric or logical scalar.
Incorrect number of input arguments. "SamplePoints" must be followed by a corresponding value.
"SamplePoints" value must be real.
"{0}" value contains duplicates.
"SamplePoints" value must be a numeric, datetime, or duration vector.
The sample points vector length must be {0,number,integer}, the same as the size of the input data in the operating dimension.
"{0}" value contains Inf or {1}.
"{0}" value must be sorted in ascending order.
"SamplePoints" value must be full.
"SamplePoints" parameter not supported when first argument is a timetable.
Parameter name must be "Endpoints" or "SamplePoints".
Invalid option. Option must be "omitnan", "includenan", "omitmissing" or "includemissing".
Window length must be a finite, positive, real scalar or 2-element vector of finite, nonnegative, real scalars.
Normalization argument must be 0 or 1.
"Endpoints" value cannot be a numeric or logical scalar when "SamplePoints" values are supplied.
NaN condition must come before parameter name and value pairs.
"Endpoints" value must be "shrink" when the "SamplePoints" values are not uniformly spaced.
Invalid data type. Window size must be a duration if "SamplePoints" value is {0}.
Incorrect number of input arguments. "DataVariables" must be followed by a corresponding value.
"DataVariables" parameter is supported only for table and timetable inputs.
Incorrect number of input arguments. "ReplaceValues" must be followed by a corresponding value.
"ReplaceValues" parameter is supported only for table and timetable inputs.
Dimension is not supported when first argument is a table or timetable.
Invalid value for "DataVariables".
A function handle specified by "DataVariables" must return a logical scalar.
Parameter name must be "Endpoints", "DataVariables", "SamplePoints", or "ReplaceValues".
"Endpoints" value must be "shrink", "fill", or a numeric or logical value when the data is tabular.
Variable "{0}" is not a valid type. Data must be numeric or logical.
"SamplePoints" is not supported for code generation.
